stadium.name: The Aegis Field
stadium.description: A pristine field within the main temple compound, used as the central training ground for the Shield. The pitch is bordered by the library and monastery, and is said to be protected by the twin lights, Dawn's Hope and Silver Twilight.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.
Drawing a detailed, anatomically incorrect diagram of a troll's head.
Passing a 'team luckstone' from player to player without speaking.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Challenging a spectator to a game of tic-tac-toe in the dirt.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.

Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Challenging a spectator to a game of tic-tac-toe in the dirt.

stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.

preGame:
# üéôÔ∏è Tuesday Night Trollball: The Final Reckoning at the Yard! üéôÔ∏è

Well hello there, sports fans! Nok the Corrupter here, coming to you live and loud from the most beautifully battered district in Osterra! We are at The Unruly Yard in New Monteforte for the absolute climax of this Losers Bracket clash! It is Game Five, folks‚Äîthe winner-takes-all finale of a Best of Five series that has seen more blood than a vampire's birthday party! The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures and the Haven Lights are tied at two games apiece, and tonight, one of them is going to be sent packing to the gutters of history! üèüÔ∏èüí•

The atmosphere here is positively electric‚Äîand I‚Äôm not just talking about the lightning jars the rowdy crowd is hurlin'! The graffiti-covered walls are practically vibrating, and the unstable scaffolding is groaning under the weight of thousands of fans who haven't seen a bath or a peaceful day in years! Looking down at the pitch, the Chaos Creatures are looking lean, mean, and ready to rebel! I see Lian Denton over there, chugging a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup‚Äînow that‚Äôs a breakfast for champions, gee whiz! ‚òï Meanwhile, Boulanger Procto is meticulously arranging his gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral. It‚Äôs a bit strange for a rebel, but hey, whatever keeps your broadsword sharp! ‚öîÔ∏è

And what about those pristine 'heroes' from Haven? They look like they've wandered into the wrong neighborhood, and boy oh boy, do I hope they stay lost! Shiroma Salim is obsessively re-taping his shield handle for the hundredth time‚Äîgive it a rest, kid, you‚Äôre about to get hit with a hammer, not a feather! üõ°Ô∏è And look at Zwart Bunns, whispering his secret fears to the Trollball. I hope his biggest fear is a Seax to the ribs, because Placido Kora is looking particularly stabby today! üî™ The Twinlights are nowhere to be seen in this smog, and the street performers are already warming up the crowd with some casual fire-breathing! üî•

The stakes couldn't be higher! The winner of this game survives to fight another day in the Losers Bracket, while the loser is officially out of the playoffs! It‚Äôs survival of the fittest, the toughest, and the meanest! We‚Äôve got an open bar, the ale is flowing like the Everwar's blood, and I expect everyone‚Äîfans and players alike‚Äîto be seeing triple by the second half! üç∫ So grab your gear, say your prayers (if you're a Haven bore), and get ready for some bone-crunching, ball-dunking action! Let‚Äôs get to the Trollball! üéôÔ∏èüòà
postGame:
# üèÜ Chaos Triumphant! Haven Lights Snuffed Out in Game Five! üèÜ

Holy Mackerel, what a total and absolute barn-burner! Nok the Corrupter here, and my horns are still buzzing from the sheer impact of that finale! The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures have clinched the series with a grit-your-teeth 3 to 2 victory over the Haven Lights! üèÜ This wasn't just a game; it was a five-game odyssey of carnage that finally ended with the 'heroes' of Haven being sent back to their library with their tails between their legs! I haven't been this delighted since Lord Orzalon let me keep a souvenir from the Demon Prison! ‚õìÔ∏èüíÄ

The action started with a bang that shook the city! Boulanger Procto, the man who likes his gear in spirals, showed that he likes his opponents in heaps by absolutely leveling Berkin Waters early on! üöë But those Havenites weren't going down without a fight. Tybi Reo retaliated by injuring Alben Diantha, but it was like trying to put out a forest fire with a water-skin! The Chaos Creatures were hungry for blood, and the Unruly Yard was more than happy to provide the stage! üèüÔ∏èü©∏

Gabriele Klehm, the kisser of Trollballs, was the hero of the first half! She snagged that leather head and let fly with a magnificent shoot from the home field that went right through the basket! üéØ 1-0 for the Creatures! The rowdy crowd went so wild I thought the scaffolding was finally going to give way and join the players on the pitch! It was a beautiful sight, seeing those Haven Lights looking so confused in the Monteforte smog! üå´Ô∏è‚ùå

But don't you worry, the Lights managed to flicker for a moment. After some frantic scrambling and more fumbles than a greased pig contest, Shiroma Salim found a gap in the center field. He let fly with a shot that actually found the mark! üèπ 1-1! I suspect it was a fluke, probably some lingering 'Shield's Watch' luck, but the scoreboard doesn't care about my demonic suspicions! The Haven fans actually started cheering, which was quite an annoying sound, let me tell you! ‚õ™üëé

The middle of the game turned into a systematic dismantling of the Monteforte roster, thanks to one man: Wieren Ivar. That mace-wielding thug went on a rampage that would‚Äôve made a goblin proud! He injured Mouldon Earl, Wolbrom Ariella, and Placido Kora in rapid succession! ü§ï It was a bloodbath, folks! The healers were working overtime, patching up Chaos players faster than they could be carted off. I haven't seen that much medical tape since Sir Tanos tried to shave with a broadsword! ‚öîÔ∏èüßº

But you can't kill a revolution with just injuries! Gabriele Klehm proved she‚Äôs the queen of the Yard by taking a pass from herself‚Äîtalk about self-reliance‚Äîand slamming the ball into the end zone for a thunderous dunk! üèÄ 2-1 for the Creatures! The momentum shifted back to Monteforte so fast I think some of the street performers got whiplash just watching! The 'Twinlight's Glow' was looking more like a dim candle in a hurricane! üïØÔ∏èüí®

The defense from our Chaos friends was simply superb. Raouf Dragone and Tucker Hett were snatching passes out of the air like they were intercepting a royal tax collector! üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Raouf snagged a wild pass from Marlane Lounge, and Tucker Hett picked off a throw from Berkin Waters that effectively ended Haven‚Äôs hopes of an easy comeback. It was a masterclass in criminal cunning, the kind of play that would make Dima the shadow king smile behind his mask! üë∫üõ°Ô∏è

As the game reached its closing stages, the violence only intensified! Urata Oriana and Shiroma Salim were trading hits like they were trying to win a facial reconstruction contest. Urata managed to take out Tybi Reo, but then Dickenson Beker leveled Urata right back! üî® It was a beautiful cycle of pain that had the crowd screaming for more! Honestly, the playoffs bring out the best‚Äîby which I mean the worst‚Äîin everyone, and isn't that just grand? üéäüíÄ

And let's talk about the drunkenness! By the third halftime, I‚Äôm pretty sure the players were using the Trollball as a pillow more than a projectile! üç∫ I saw Coward Tarton throw a pass that landed in a bucket of gravy, and Fogel Raynold was trying to tackle a spectator who was actually a cardboard cutout of Count Trez Arrigo! The open bar at The Unruly Yard certainly lived up to its reputation, and I think some of those 'wild passes' were just players trying to find the floor! üçπüòµ

The final tally was 3-2, a victory for the Chaos Creatures and a series win of 3 games to 2! üèÜ The Haven Lights are officially extinguished, eliminated from the playoffs and sent back to their pristine monastery to think about their life choices. I bet Dame Terra Monteforte is having a riotous party in the dirt tonight, while the High Prince is probably wishing he‚Äôd invested in some better armor for his boys! üè∞‚ùå

So, the New Monteforte Chaos Creatures advance in the Losers Bracket! They showed more grit, more heart, and significantly more willingness to break teeth than those 'holy' boys! ü¶∑üî® It was a series for the ages, and I‚Äôm just glad I was here to watch the light fail! I‚Äôm going to go find where Lian Denton keeps the celebratory hot gravy and see if I can‚Äôt find a street performer to juggle some of Haven's leftover dignity! üé™‚ú®

This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from the most beautiful disaster in New Monteforte! üéôÔ∏è The Creatures win 3-2! The series is over! Keep your weapons sharp, your ale cold, and your healers on the payroll! Goodnight, Osterra, and stay brutal! üéôÔ∏èüòà
